entry.et: Middle English, from Anglo-French empire, empirie, from Latin imperium absolute authority, empire, from imperare to command emperor

def.dt: :a major political unit having a territory of great extent or a number of territories or peoples under a single sovereign authority
:one having an emperor as chief of state
:the territory of such a political unit
:an extensive territory or enterprise under single domination or control
def.set: Empire State, nickname for New York
def.dt: :a juicy apple with dark red skin that is a cross between a McIntosh apple and a Red Delicious apple

entry.et: French, from (le premier) Empire the first Empire of France

def.dt: :of, relating to, or characteristic of a style (as of clothing or furniture) popular in early 19th century France
:commonwealth day used before the official adoption of Commonwealth Day in 1958
:of, relating to, or characteristic of a style (as of furniture) developed in France under Napoleon III and marked by heavy ornate modification of Empire styles
a former empire consisting of Great Britain & the British dominions & dependencies see commonwealth of nations
region NW United States between Cascade Range & Rocky Mountains in E Washington, N Idaho, NW Montana, & NE Oregon
former Turkish sultanate in SE Europe, W Asia, & N Africa including at greatest extent Turkey, Syria, Mesopotamia, Palestine, Arabia, Egypt, Barbary States, Balkans, & parts of Russia & Hungary
:an empire consisting primarily of a loose confederation of German and Italian territories under the suzerainty of an emperor and existing from the 9th or 10th century to 1806
realm of varying extent in cen Europe in medieval & modern periods with Germany as chief component
